thread.title: PREVIEW: The Dualers, Talking Heads, Southampton
thread.title_full: PREVIEW: The Dualers, Talking Heads, Southampton

title: PREVIEW: The Dualers, Talking Heads, Southampton
text:
0 comments 
THE Dualers are a nine-piece Jamaican Rhythm & Blues band from South-East London. 
They first hit the headlines when the single Kiss on the Lips stormed into the UK top 30 despite no industry or professional backing. They progressed to playing alongside some of the finest names in Ska and Reggae including The Skatalites, Toots and The Maytals, Ziggy Marley, Jimmy Cliff, UB40 and Madness. 
With a number of album releases, several top 40 chart singles, a record breaking seven sell out shows at indigo at the 02 and an ever increasing large worldwide fan base behind them their success has continued. Now heralded as the UKâ€™s finest Ska & Reggae band, The Dualers continue to play to sell-out crowds all over the UK, Europe & Asia. 
2015 sees the band taking their upbeat energetic show all over the UK and the upcoming performance at Talking Heads in Southampton on Saturday will be something of a homecoming for two members of the band. Share article 
Bass player Jason Gale is from Eastleigh & attended Alderman Quilley School whilst sax player Tim Ower is also from Hampshire and has spent the past two years teaching music at Southampton University. 
Tickets: talkingheads.vticket.co.uk PREVIEW: The Dualers, Talking Heads, Southampton Sorry, an error occurred.
